CatDescriptText: Mrs. Anita Hoyle, divorcee, stenographer-clerk, 7165 Vann Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "Kids make a difference. However, some people, who are incompatible, should divorce for the kids' sake rather than subject them to a lot of bickering and arguement which keeps them upset."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Anita Hoyle wearing light colored trench coat and eyeglasses, carrying handbag and Lerner Shops box standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
